results.title: Bartleby
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Herman Melville’s story about Bartleby, the scrivener, who answers an advertisement for work with a lawyer and after a brief spurt of intense work, gradually breaks down, refuses to move and eventually dies because he has lost the will to live. A detailed discussion and analysis of the story follows. Features a cameo appearance of the actor who played Greg Brady in the popular television series ‘The Brady Bunch’ as a law clerk.

results.title: Bars of silver
results.creator_credit: Editorial Film Productions and Unilever Films
results.brief_description: Every day at fishing ports along the coast of Britain, fishermen land their catch. Twenty-four hours later the fish is available for sale in shops all over the country. This film illustrates all aspects of this industry - the trawlers and drifters; busy quaysides and fish auctions, the freezing, filleting, washing and boxing; trains criss-crossing through the night; centuries old Billingsgate fish market.

results.title: Barriers
results.brief_description: A group of young people discuss the problems a particular person has in relating in American Society. Unrehearsed, the film talks about such topics as racial conflicts, suspicion, gangs and the social/economic classes. No other credits available.

results.title: Barra the new sonobuoy
results.brief_description: A new development in anti-submarine sensors, the sonobuoy, is dropped from anti-submarine aircraft and automatically anchored. Its range and accuracy is extremely good and the Barra sonobuoy is manufactured entirely in Australia. No other credits available.

results.title: Baroque
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Orchestra Series”.
Describes the evolution of the modern symphony orchestra from its beginnings in the 17th century to the present. The range and versatility of the orchestra of the early 18th century is shown in the first movement “Winter” of Vivaldi’s “Four Seasons”. Court orchestras gave composers the chance to experiment and soon other instruments, such as the bassoon and the oboe, were added to the string band, making it possible to contrast and balance different instrumental sounds. But it was not until the second half of the 18th century that the symphony really came into its own with the work of Joseph Haydn the “father of the symphony”.

results.title: Bargemen on the Rhine
results.brief_description: Shows how barges move along the Rhine carrying goods and produce. Details the operation and servicing and life aboard a modern tug. Suitable for upper primary and secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Barefoot student army
results.creator_credit: Catherine Marciniak, John Moore, Lyndal Barry, Open Channel Productions and Sophie Barry
results.brief_description: In March 1988, Burmese students took to the streets in the capital Rangoon as a protest against the oppressive rule of Prime Minister Ne Win. Ten thousand protesters were killed in what was perceived to be a typical response by Government forces. Many students, fighting for survival, fled into the jungle in order to find freedom. Sophie and Lyndall Barry, two young Melbourne film makers, intended to stay only a matter of days, but remained for a year recording the plight of these students on the Thai/Burma border. A compelling documentary providing insight into one of the politically sensitive regions of Asia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Catherine Marciniak, John Moore, Lyndal Barry, Open Channel Productions and Sophie Barry

results.title: Bardell vs Pickwick
results.creator_credit: Desmond Davis and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Describes the trial for breach of promise and the many amusing moments which arise when Mr. Pickwick’s landlady interprets his discussion regarding the hiring of a man servant as a proposal for marriage. Introduced by Frederic March.

results.title: Banksia Serrata
results.brief_description: One of a group of four films which looks at a species of native tree, growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland. Sound is of a solo flute mixed with native bird calls. Music: Nancy Tow. No other credits available.
